1.text: Heat 2 teaspoons (9.9 ml) of olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.

2.text: Sauté onions with peppers for 3 minutes if you'd like veggies in the omelet.

3.text: Heat chopped tomato and ham for 2 minutes for a more filling omelet.

4.text: Transfer the optional mixture to a bowl and turn the burner down to medium.

5.text: Whisk 3 egg whites in a separate bowl and pour them into the skillet.

6.text: Cook the whites for 2 to 3 minutes or until they're set and no longer runny.

7.text: Turn off the burner and fill half of the omelet.

8.text: Use a spatula to fold the omelet over the filling and serve it while it's hot.

9.text: Heat 1⁄2 tablespoon (7.4 ml) of olive oil in a skillet over medium-high.

10.text: Sauté garlic, spinach, and tomatoes if you want to add veggies.

11.text: Whisk the egg whites, milk, salt, and pepper in a separate bowl.

12.text: Pour the egg whites into the skillet and turn the burner to medium.

13.text: Stir the scrambled egg whites as they cook for 2 to 3 minutes.

14.text: Stir in the sautéed vegetables, if applicable, and serve the scrambled egg whites.

15.text: Spray the inside of a microwave-safe dish with nonstick cooking spray.

16.text: Put 4 egg whites into a bowl with milk, salt, and pepper.

18.text: Pour the mixture into the prepared dish and microwave it on "high" for 45 seconds.

19.text: Open the microwave and break up the eggs with a fork.

20.text: Microwave the egg whites for another 45 seconds before you stir them.

21.text: Heat cream cheese over the egg whites for a more flavorful dish.

22.text: Remove the dish and sprinkle optional fresh herbs over it before serving.
